business.headline: Crypto crash wipes out $19 billion after Trump's 100% China tariffs spark sell-offThe cryptocurrency market suffered a historic crash after US President Donald Trump announced 100% tariffs on China and new export controls on software.

Crisis brews at Bira 91: How a name change shook the popular beer brandFrom beer icon to regulatory nightmare, Bira 91's journey shows how a minor administrative tweak can spiral into financial chaos, employee unrest, and investor anxiety.

LG Electronics vs Tata Capital IPO: What should be your strategy post-listing?Two IPOs, two very different strategies. Tata Capital offers steady long-term growth, while LG Electronics promises quick listing gains. Read on to plan post-listing moves and investment approach carefully.

LG Electronics IPO allotment is finally out. How much listing gain you can expect?Investors who received allotments may be sitting on potential listing gains of Rs 5,000–Rs 6,000 per lot, depending on market sentiment at the time of debut.

Anil Ambani aide and senior Reliance Power executive arrested by EDThe arrest of Ashok Pal, who serves as the executive director at Reliance Power, is related to a suspected fake bank guarantee racket worth Rs 68.2 crore.

Tata History: When Nehru, Jinnah, and Bose allied to save steel companyStarting as a company trading in cotton and opium, the Tata Group has weathered colonial economic warfare, nationalist politics, labor upheaval, and insurgent crises. But it has always emerged stronger through vision, sacrifice, and resilience. In the final episode of our series on the group, we revisit two storms that threatened to sink the Tata brand and image.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as financial stocks rally; Cipla, SBI among top gainersSensex ends 328 points higher, Nifty above 25,250; Cipla, SBI lead gains

Convenience or debt trap? The hidden cost of BPNL, easy credit and festive offersEvery festive season, easy credit makes everything—from gadgets to holidays—look affordable. But behind the glitter of BNPL schemes and "no-cost EMIs" lies a growing debt trap that's quietly eroding financial freedom.

Tata Trusts trustee Vijay Singh calls internal rift unprecedented: ReportVijay Singh, who serves as a trustee and vice-chairman of Tata Trusts, said that the act of voting on internal matters went against the long-standing principles followed during Ratan Tata's leadership.

WeWork India slips 5% in debut trade amid valuation, governance concernsCorporate governance firm InGovern warned investors of WeWork India's fragile financials, negative cash flow, high lease liabilities, and the absence of fresh capital infusion.

Buy, borrow, die: The wealth cheat code the rich don't share, explains CAEver wondered how wealthy families keep growing their wealth while others struggle with taxes and inflation? CA reveals a simple three-step strategy: Buy, Borrow, Die. Have a look.

LG Electronics IPO GMP touches Rs 400: Here's how to check allotment statusLG IPO: The GMP is an indicator of market sentiment, showing the expected difference between the IPO price and the likely listing price. With the upper price band set at Rs 1,140, a GMP of Rs 400 suggests the shares could debut at around Rs 1,540, implying potential listing gains of roughly 35%.
TCS reports 20,000 layoffs, employees' advocacy group questions transparencyThe IT giant's employee strength fell from 6,13,069 on June 30 to 5,93,314, according to Q2FY26 data posted on its website.

Stopping PF contributions? What it means for your retirement savingsPausing your PF contributions may seem harmless, but it can slow down your retirement savings. Even if your money stays safe, missing deposits could mean losing valuable interest and tax benefits over time.

What's brewing at Bira 91? Over 250 employees seek removal of founder, says reportEmployees cited "corporate governance failure, lack of transparency, delays in salaries and dues," as well as cases filed by creditors indicating deteriorating financials and pending vendor payments.

Tata Capital IPO vs LG IPO GMP: Which one is likely to give better returns? Tata Capital's IPO, priced between Rs 310–Rs 326, shows modest grey market premiums of Rs 6–Rs 7, indicating limited listing gains. LG Electronics India's IPO, at Rs 1,140, boasts Rs 380 GMP, suggesting strong upside.

Bitcoin slips again. 3 reasons why the crypto market is downBitcoin's price has slipped again this week, signalling renewed volatility in the digital asset space. From rising US inflation worries to ETF outflows, here's what's dragging crypto prices lower.

The legacy of Tata Trusts, beyond the boardroomTata Trusts is one of India's oldest, largest, and most influential philanthropic foundations.  A group of public charitable trusts set up by members of the Tata family, the present-day Trusts trace their origin to the working-class-focused JN Endowment Fund, started by Jamsetji Tata.
Sensex, Nifty trade higher after flat start as banks lead gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 232.01 points to 82,404.11, while the NSE Nifty50 added 70.60 points to 25,252.40 as of 9:32 am.

UK PM Keir Starmer calls Paytm the 'Superstar' of Indian fintech industryUK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said that the rise of Indian fintech companies on the world stage driven by technological innovation, digital inclusion, and entrepreneurial scale.

entertainment.headline: Oscar-winning actress Diane Keaton dies at 79 Oscar-winning actress Diane Keaton, famed for Annie Hall, The Godfather, and The First Wives Club, has died at 79 in California. Her family has requested privacy as they mourn.

Filmfare Awards 2025 winners: Who took home the big trophies? Full list inside 'Laapataa Ladies', starring Pratibha Ranta and Nitanshi Goel, clinched the majority of awards at the 71st Filmfare Awards 2025. The star-studded ceremony is being held in Ahmedabad.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Salman denies favouring Amaal, exposes Tanya Actor Salman Khan addressed allegations of being partial towards singer Amaal Mallik in 'Bigg Boss 19' on Weekend Ka Vaar. He also exposed spiritual influencer Tanya Mittal's game to the rest of the contestants.

PM Modi's passion will boost archery legacy: Ram Charan after meeting Actor Ram Charan and his wife Upasana Kamineni Konidela met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the national capital on Saturday. The meeting focused on the Archery Premier League.

Ram Charan's daring mountain dance for Peddi song goes viral. Watch A video of actor Ram Charan performing a dance sequence on a rocky cliff edge has gone viral. The behind-the-scenes clip is from the sets of his much-awaited film 'Peddi.'

Punjabi folk singer Gurmeet Singh Maan dies due to heart complications Punjabi folk singer Gurmeet Singh Maan, who was also a police officer, has died. Maan's songs often reflected the traditions of rural Punjab.

Exclusive: Gulshan Devaiah on Kannada debut, Bhoota Kola, self-belief and more Actor Gulshan Devaiah, who was recently seen in 'Kantara: Chapter 1', exclusively spoke to IndiaToday.in about his experience working with Rishab Shetty, witnessing the Bhoota Kola tradition in Karnataka, his message for outsiders in the film industry, and more.

Ajay Devgn's De De Pyaar De sequel gets a release date. Check poster The sequel to 'De De Pyaar De' finally has a release date. Actor Ajay Devgn on Saturday shared the first motion poster of the upcoming film and hinted at the plot.

Felt like dream: Saira Banu recalls wedding with Dilip Kumar on 59th anniversary On their 59th wedding anniversary, veteran actor Saira Banu reminisced about her wedding night with late actor Dilip Kumar, calling it a dreamlike and joy-filled evening. She fondly recalled the simplicity, chaos, and heartfelt moments that made the day unforgettable.

Amitabh Bachchan turns 83: Prabhas to Farhan Akhtar, celebs share birthday wishes Bollywood legend Amitabh Bachchan turned 83 today, with celebrities like Shatrughan Sinha, Farhan Akhtar, Prabhas, and Srijit Mukherji sharing heartfelt birthday wishes for the megastar.

Creating something with Allu Arjun, reveals Atlee Director Atlee, said his upcoming film with Allu Arjun will be something very new, very intriguing, addictive to watch, promising a visually striking and innovative experience. The high-profile project, tentatively titled 'AA22 x A6', also stars Deepika Padukone, with speculation about other big names joining the cast.

Kareena Kapoor shares Taimur chooses sports over acting: He has no clue about actors Kareena Kapoor shared that her son Taimur Ali Khan has no interest in acting and prefers sports and other activities instead. Despite being the child of Bollywood superstars, Taimur is exploring his own passions at school.

Fans pull Billie Eilish into crowd during Miami concert, safely rescued by security During her Miami concert on October 9, Billie Eilish was pulled into the crowd by a fan but was quickly rescued by security and continued her performance. The incident left the singer visibly shaken, highlighting ongoing safety concerns she has faced in recent years.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Nandhini walks out after full-blown meltdown  'Bigg Boss Tamil' Season 9 contestant Nandhini exited the show after a meltdown, citing her inability to act or play along for content. Her departure left both contestants and fans emotional, with many praising her for prioritising her mental health.

Rashmika shares glimpse of ring amid engagement buzz with Vijay Deverakonda Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are engaged and planning to marry in February 2026, following an intimate ceremony in Hyderabad. Rashmika recently shared the first glimpse of her engagement ring, delighting fans and subtly confirming the news.

Diwali 2025 box office: The lights are on, but where are the biggies? As Diwali 2025 lights up theatres across India, Bollywood bets on 'Thamma', 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat', and 'Mahayoddha Rama', while the South stays unusually silent. Trade experts decode how the festival's once-guaranteed box office magic is evolving -- from star-driven spectacles to content-led cinema -- and what the changing festive calendar means for India's biggest movie season.

Akshay Kumar's Teri Mitti performance wins hearts at Gujarat event. Watch Akshay Kumar moved audiences with a performance of 'Teri Mitti' at 'Mera Desh Pehle' event in Gujarat. Dressed in traditional attire, he left a lasting impact with his emotional tribute to India.

Happy Birthday Amitabh Bachchan: How the icon stays relevant in the era of Gen Z Amitabh Bachchan turns 83 on October 11. A look at how the legend of cinema has seamlessly moved from his larger-than-life image of yore to one of the biggest phenomena on Indian reality TV

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 9: Rishab's film surpasses Rs 350 crore in India Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1' continues its dream run, crossing Rs 350 crore in India and Rs 500 crore worldwide. The film regained momentum in its second week, with strong occupancy across all languages and regions.

general news.headline: 12 Pakistani soldiers killed as Taliban seize border posts along Durand LineTaliban forces seized multiple Pakistani outposts along the Durand Line, killing 12 soldiers, in retaliatory cross-border clashes after a Pakistani airstrike in Kabul this week.
Hamas to skip Gaza peace deal signing, calls Trump's proposals absurd: ReportHamas will skip the Gaza peace deal signing in Egypt, calling proposals for its members' departure from Gaza "absurd".

You are great: US envoy meets PM Modi, gifts him signed photo with Trump's messageUS Ambassador-designate Sergio Gor met PM Modi in New Delhi to discuss defence, trade, technology, and critical minerals, presenting him a signed photo from Trump, who called Modi a "great and personal friend".

Wounded India eye comeback vs mighty Australia in sold-out Vizag showdownDays after a heartbreaking loss to South Africa, a bruised Indian side would like to make a strong comeback when they come up against the unbeaten Australians in a sold-out showdown at Vizag.

Watch: Rare tornado whirls over Odisha's Chilika Lake, sends tourists scramblingThe rare phenomenon was spotted in the southwestern direction of Goddess Kalijai Temple, the presiding deity of Chilika lake.

Hamas confirms release of Israeli hostages from Gaza to begin on MondayHamas confirmed the release of 48 hostages, mostly Israelis, will begin on Monday under a US-mediated ceasefire, preceding Israel's release of 2,000 Palestinians, ahead of a Gaza peace summit.

Odisha medical student raped on Bengal hospital premises, slugfest eruptsThe incident in Bengal's Durgapur, the biggest industrial hub of the state, is reminiscent of the 2024 RG Kar case where a junior doctor was raped and murdered, triggering nationwide outrage.

Three Qatari diplomats killed in Egypt car crash day before Gaza peace summitThree Qatari diplomats died and two were injured in a car crash near Egypt's Red Sea resort city of Sharm el-Sheikh, a day before the city is set to host an international leaders summit on a Gaza ceasefire.

Will face same fate as Rahul Gandhi did in Amethi: PK's warning to TejashwiRaghopur has historically been dominated by the Yadav family, with Lalu Prasad Yadav and Rabri Devi having won multiple terms and served as Chief Ministers of Bihar.

I will protect Shubman Gill, unfair things have been said about him: Gautam GambhirHead coach Gautam Gambhir backed Shubman Gill, praising the 25-year-old for handling pressure with composure during India's England tour. Gambhir said Gill had passed his toughest test as captain and promised to support him fully, highlighting the young leader's strong start.

Zelenskyy praises Trump for Gaza peace deal, says he can stop Ukraine war tooUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy congratulated US President Donald Trump on his Gaza peace deal and urged him to broker peace in Ukraine and bring Russia to the negotiating table.

Election body seeks clip of Mamata Banerjee 'threatening' state poll chief: SourcesThe Election Commission has sought video footage and translation of West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's alleged threatening remarks against the state's Chief Electoral Officer. The move follows a complaint by the BJP and comes ahead of next year's Assembly polls.

Why the 30-30-3 method can be the ultimate gut hack you needAnother day, another wellness trend on the block, and this one's for a happy gut. As gut health takes on the wellness world, the 30-30-3 framework might just be the hack you didn't know you needed.

Is the Nobel Peace Prize too political? Controversial winners over the yearsThe 2025 Peace Prize to María Corina Machado has revived old arguments about politics and the Nobel Peace Prize. Here's a list of the controversial Peace Prize laureates and why each choice drew criticism.

Slap on society: Bhagwant Mann meets Y Puran Kumar's family, urges Haryana to actPunjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Saturday met the family of deceased Haryana IPS officer Y Puran Kumar in Chandigarh, calling his death "a slap on the face of society."

NDA holds crucial Bihar seat-sharing talks, Jitan Ram Manjhi upset with formulaSenior NDA leaders from Bihar have converged in Delhi for crucial discussions on seat sharing. The outcome of these talks will shape the alliance's electoral strategy and candidate selection for the upcoming state assembly polls.

sports.headline: Wounded India eye comeback vs mighty Australia in sold-out Vizag showdown Days after a heartbreaking loss to South Africa, a bruised Indian side would like to make a strong comeback when they come up against the unbeaten Australians in a sold-out showdown at Vizag.

We've beaten Australia in the past and will give our best again: Sneh Rana India all-rounder Sneh Rana has said that they will take confidence from their previous victories against Australia into their upcoming Women's World Cup 2025 encounter. India are set to take on Australia in their fourth fixture of the Women's World Cup 2025 on Sunday, October 11 in Visakhapatnam.

Watch: Father Naushad follows Sarfaraz Khan, loses 38 kg in stunning transformation Inspired by his son Sarfaraz Khan, father Naushad lost 38 kilos in six months. Sarfaraz and his father underwent a lifestyle change as the Mumbai batter started to work on his fitness in a bid to make his way back into the Indian team.

England still not at their best despite big win over Sri Lanka: Nat Sciver-Brunt England captain Nat Sciver-Brunt scored a record-breaking century to help her team thrash Sri Lanka by 89 runs in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup. Despite the big win, she highlighted the need for stronger partnerships in the middle overs for consistent performances.

One of the most difficult moments in our history: USA cricket on ICC suspension USA Cricket has entered a challenging period after its suspension by the ICC and bankruptcy filing, citing a dispute with American Cricket Enterprise and a focus on safeguarding the sport's integrity in the US.

Watch: Fans, dressing room erupt as Namibia stun South Africa in maiden T20I tie Namibia secured an incredible win over South Africa in their first T20I tie against the Proteas on Saturday, October 11. The fans and the Namibian dressing room erupted as Zane Green hit the winning runs.

Brunt, Ecclestone annihilate Sri Lanka as England rise to top with 89-run win Nat Sciver-Brunt's century and Sophie Ecclestone's four wickets powered England to an 89-run win over Sri Lanka in the ICC Women's World Cup 2025. Courtesy of their win, they rose to the top of the points table with their third successive win.

India have been a sleeping giant in the women's game for a long time: Alyssa Healy Australia captain Alyssa Healy called India the sleeping giant of women's cricket and spoke about the impact of the Women's Premier League (WPL) on their game ahead of their fixture in the Women's World Cup 2025 on Sunday, October 12.

Getting Olympics 2036 will be absolutely transformative for India: Carl Lewis In an exclusive chat with India Today, Carl Lewis said that becoming the home of the 2036 Olympics will be transformative for India. Lewis also said that India is just a little infrastructure away from becoming one of the greatest sporting countries in the world.

Ravindra Jadeja opens up on captaincy aspirations: That time has gone long back Ravindra Jadeja opened up on his captaincy aspirations after being given the vice-captaincy role in the Indian Test team in the absence of Rishabh Pant.

Can Pakistan make winning start in redemption journey against world champions?PAK vs SA: Shan Masood's Pakistan and Aiden Markram's South Africa are all set to lock horns in a two-match Test series, starting October 12 at the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore.

Watch: Nat Sciver-Brunt dedicates century to newborn with cradle celebrationNat Sciver-Brunt stole the spotlight with a heartwarming 'Bebeto' baby-rocking celebration for her newborn after scoring her 10th ODI century against Sri Lanka in the Women's World Cup.

Jadeja praises Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal: Young generation taking responsibilityRavindra Jadeja heaped praise on Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal after their hundreds in the ongoing Delhi Test against West Indies. Jaiswal and Gill's hundreds helped India post a mammoth total of 518 runs in the first innings of the second Test.

Shubman Gill has shown great composure after being given captaincy: Anil KumbleLegendary India leg spinner Anil Kumble has said that Shubman Gill has shown great composure after being given the India captaincy. Gill scored his fifth century as skipper on Day 2 of the second Test against West Indies at Arun Jaitley in Delhi.

Alyssa Healy pins hopes on trump card Sophie Molineux to deliver vs IndiaAlyssa Healy expects Sophie Molineux to play a key role as Australia take on India in Sunday's Women's World Cup clash in Vizag. Australia, atop the points table, hope to leverage favourable conditions and a sold-out crowd for an exciting contest.

Compete against yourself: Neeraj Chopra gets key advice from Olympic legend Carl LewisOlympic legend Carl Lewis advised Neeraj Chopra to start competing against himself to remain on top of the world. Neeraj had an up and down season in 2025 as he lost his crown at the World Athletics Championships.

Exclusive: Avani Lekhara On Para-Athletics In India & Her Training For Upcoming World CupIn this India Today special report, star para-shooter Avani Lekhara discusses her recent ramp walk in Delhi, secret preparations for the 2026 season, and managing the pressure of expectations. On the nervousness that comes with being a top athlete, Lekhara stated, 'second Paralympics was much tougher than the first one and I think it will be same for him as well and we were going with a lot of expectations and there was nervousness, there was jitters...'. She reveals she is training for an upcoming World Cup in the UAE this month. Lekhara also details a significant overhaul of her equipment, including a new rifle and shooting wheelchair, as she prepares for the 2026 Asian Para Games and World Para Shooting Championships. She shares her perspective on the growth of para-sports in India, following the country's record medal haul at the recent World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi.

Arshad's coach slams Pak athletics body, says relied on friend's financial aidArshad Nadeem finished a disappointing 10th in the World Athletics Championships men's javelin final in Tokyo in September. The Pakistan Sports Board demanded an explanation from the Olympic champion for the dismal show.

Ravindra Jadeja breaks silence on Australia ODI snub: Want to play World Cup 2027Ravindra Jadeja broke his silence on being snubbed from India's squad for the upcoming ODI series against Australia and said he still hopes to be a part of the World Cup 2027. Jadeja was part of India's squad in the Champions Trophy.

India troubled by left-arm spinners in World Cup? Sneh Rana plays down concernsSneh Rana played down concerns over India's struggles against left-arm spin, expressing confidence that the team's experienced batters will bounce back strongly. On Sunday, India will face Australia in Vizag.

Under-fire Pratika Rawal trains hard as India gear up for Australia test in VizagWomen's World Cup: After three solid starts in the group stage, Pratika Rawal worked hard in the nets on the eve of the big-ticket clash against Australia. India had an optional training sesssion before Sneh Rana addressed the press in Visakhapatnam on Saturday.

Exclusive: Carl Lewis Backs India's 2036 Olympic Bid, Offers Advice For Neeraj ChopraIn this exclusive conversation, India Today speaks with nine-time Olympic gold medalist Carl Lewis, who was in Delhi as the international ambassador for the Delhi Half Marathon. Lewis shares his strong support for India's 2036 Olympic bid and gives his expert advice to two-time Olympic medalist Neeraj Chopra. When asked what it takes to stay at the top, Lewis stated, 'what happens when you become number one in the world, you no longer competing against the world, you're competing against yourself.' The athletic icon also discusses the infrastructure and national unity required for a successful Olympic Games, his experience walking the ramp for a cause, and the importance of sustainability and youth sports programs for the country's future.

West Indies fight better, but India well ahead after Shubman Gill specialIndia vs West Indies, 2nd Test:** West Indies produced their best batting display of the tour, but they remained 378 runs behind at stumps on Day 2. Captain Shubman Gill scored an unbeaten 129, while Ravindra Jadeja took three wickets to keep India firmly in control.

Ditch macho image: Jude Bellingham calls for better care on mental healthJude Bellingham urges athletes to speak openly about mental health struggles, addresses the impact of online abuse, and highlights the importance of support and empathy within the sporting community.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
